title: Rustdoc 1.60 produces flat UI

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-rustdoc-themes
labels.description: Area: themes for HTML pages generated by rustdoc

body:
Rustdoc 1.59 and earlier used to produce a nice clean UI, Rustdoc 1.60 is weirdly flat and inconvenient.

### Version it worked on

1.59 and earlier:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/724639/162482967-606d055a-0b26-4dee-abeb-77bc082f1d01.png)


### Version with regression

1.60 and later:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/724639/162483019-f9c761e3-0ca2-416a-ba21-83634c2ad1f0.png)

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.60.0 (7737e0b5c 2022-04-04)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 7737e0b5c4103216d6fd8cf941b7ab9bdbaace7c
commit-date: 2022-04-04
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.60.0
LLVM version: 14.0.0
```

<!--
If you know when this regression occurred, please add a line like below, replacing `{channel}` with one of stable, beta, or nightly.

@rustbot modify labels: +regression-from-stable-to-{channel} -regression-untriaged
-->
